Sathappan
Budget friendly phone
Reviewed in India on 29 July 2025
Verified Purchase
Bought the phone 1 month ago. Product is light weight and comfortable to use. UI is user friendly. This phone is good for elderly persons who have minimal needs and don't do multitasking. All OTT platforms stream fine with high quality, colours and sound are good. Camera is okay. Charging adapter is not included in the package. We need to buy seperately. Original Samsung 25W charging adapter alone costs Rs.900 to Rs.1,000. Other brands 25W charging adapter costs around Rs.400 to Rs.600. Please do keep this in mind while buying the phone. Instead of buying new adapter I am using the old phones 10W charging adapter and cable (USB to Type-C) so far all good. If your budget is between Rs.6,000 to Rs.7,000 then this is very good choice.

Giving 4 stars because charging adapter is not included.

Swarnadip Barik
Under rs 6500 smartphone this device is worth it.
Reviewed in India on 25 September 2025
Verified Purchase
According to the price just buy it if you get this product in around 6500 otherwise go for other brands Interface feels laggy but you can watch youtube videos in 1440p(2k). And otherwise this device can support 25W fast charging. The time it takes (0 to 100%) around 1:30 min battery is good single speaker and the speaker quality is decent. Camara quality is not top notch but decent. It handle day to day task like phone calls taking pictures and chats (WhatsApp) etc this device can handle it properly. NOT RECOMMENDED FOR GAMING. Overall according to the price this is a great value for money product. I bought it in rs. 6249 (Great Indian Festival) so this phone is value for money for day to day user under 7000 rs smartphones.

Customers say
Customers praise the phone's top-notch quality, premium design, and excellent display with fantastic picture quality. The camera receives positive feedback, with one customer noting it delivers flagship-level shots, and customers consider it a good value for its price point. Battery life and performance receive mixed reviews - while the 25W fast charging is decent, customers report the battery drains fast, and some experience performance issues. Heating is also a mixed aspect, with some customers reporting no heating issues while others mention the phone heats up quickly.

Top reviews from India
Paromita Ghatak
A balanced near flagship experience
Reviewed in India on 9 September 2025
Verified Purchase
Everything is too good about the phone , is display camera and built quality is top notch , there's actually no difference between exynos 2400e and exynos 2400 in real time use unless you throttle the cpu very much under heavy gaming, runs multitasking super smoothly and you'll love the smoothness with an array of customisation options , camera quality can be said top notch in this range at least compared to oneplus 13r, exynos performs pretty well .... the main cons that I've experienced are that gets heat up in long and direct exposure to sunlight and battery backup is not that good , drains pretty plus even phones within 25k range and lesser battery (4000mah) has good optimisation ( I previously used vivo v21e with 3900mah battery) , though the charging stays well for a day if moderately used( small productivity, camera, browsing, youtube, netflix) , exynos has done pretty well ... if you're balanced user with a pretty taste for photo and videography and want flagship like experience in this price segment, you can go with it , heating is very minimal ( actually no one uses his phone under direct sun exposure for hours) , but the battery back up could be far more good .
15 people found this helpful

Pravin
Good phone for a very good price 35k
Reviewed in India on 9 July 2025
Verified Purchase
You can go for it, if someone is looking for a good midrange phone. By the way they will tell you it's midrange, it's not. It's flagship at not so flagship price. It's not for heavy use as the battery is average. Average usage will last a day. The feel is premium. Processor is good for multi-tasking. Yes gamers might complain but please dont buy Samsung phone especially if all you want to do is gaming. Samsung is not for gaming, but for that smooth software experience, brand value and reliability. Camera is good. Online you might find mixed reviews as there are other phones offering better hardware and features at this price. At the end of the day software plays a huge part in user experience.

Manish
A Complete Package - must buy
Reviewed in India on 27 July 2025
Verified Purchase
This phone is huge which is very helpful for me for performing my all day to day work. The Display and the AI features of samsung has no competition. Great sound quality and haptics. Photos and videos come out very beautiful in bright conditions. Weighs and feels like a brick which is fine. Even though all other chinese brand at 35k feels a better option but this phone is a complete package which doesn't feel to be missing out on anything. Charging speed is fine(managable). The quality of phone is top notch - feels very premium. Gorilla glass victus feels like a cherry on the cake. I have all - samsung tab, buds and a laptop - the ecosystem is just crazy good, works butter smooth with each other. As I student I samsung notes helps me alot and I can access them whenever wherever on whichever device I want. For me it feels like freedom. I am very happy with this product and the economy.

Vivek
Broad review of S24 FE
Reviewed in India on 5 June 2025
Verified Purchase
Amazing phone with all the S series flagship features. If you're looking for the premium features of samsung on a budget then this is the perfect phone.
Regarding the heating issue it did get quite warm on the first bootup but after updating it to the latest version it's much better. The only time it heats is when you're using camera for a long time or doing some heavy gaming.
Battery life is average I would say, not the best in the market but for a person with not much heavy usage it would last a day.
Video stabilization is one of the best you can get in this price range.
As of now no performance drops or lags it's quite what I expected to be after seeing all the reviews before buying this phone.
Wouldn't recommend this phone for intensive gamers as thermal throttling is there.
Overall for 35k is definitely a value for money phone right now.
31 people found this helpful
